questions.question: Which colonial region had the most religious diversity during the 1700's?

choices.answer: New England colonies
Southern colonies
Middle (Mid-Atlantic) colonies
Backcountry

questions.question: What was the American colonists' primary objection to the taxes imposed by the Stamp Act?

choices.answer: It was the 1st time the British tried to control them.
It set the rate so high that it harmed the colonial economy.
It had not been approved by colonial representatives.
It interfered with merchants' right to free trade.

questions.question: Which important U.S. document was influenced by the French in 1776?

choices.answer: the Bill of Rights
the U.S.Constitution
the Articles of Confederation
the Declaration of Independence

questions.question: Which newspaper headline best illustrates the ineffectiveness of the Articles of Confederation?

choices.answer: Whiskey Rebellion Begins in Western Pennsylvania
New York Imposes Tariff on Connecticut Goods
Supreme Court Denied Power of Judicial Review
Land Ordinance of 1785 Issued by Congress

questions.question: What was an important argument that the Federalists made in support of a new constitution?

choices.answer: It would weaken slavery.
It would protect states' rights
It would strengthen the economy.
It would protect the rights of the individual.

questions.question: Which aspect of economic policy did Thomas Jefferson and Alexander Hamilton agree upon?

choices.answer: The U.S. government should pass a protective tariff.
The U.S. gov't should use liquor taxes to raise revenue.
The U.S.gov't should pay off war debt to foreign countries.
The U.S.gov't should insure deposits in the Bank of the U.S.

questions.question: What was one important outcome of McCulloch vs. Maryland (1819)?

choices.answer: the principle of no taxation without representation
the establishment of a federal government
the strengthening of judicial review
the creation of a national bank

questions.question: Which characteristic is most commonly associated with the westward expansion of the U.S.?

choices.answer: industrialism
mercantilism
individualism
reformism

questions.question: During the 1800s, what was frequently cited as a justification for U.S. expansionist policies?

choices.answer: the Bill of Rights
social contract
Manifest Destiny
Gospel of Wealth

questions.question: Which factor most encouraged the trend shown in the graph?

choices.answer: an increase of paid cotton workers in the South
the growth of industrial production in the South
the rise of textile manufacturing in England and the U.S.
increase in the # of railroads that crossed the continent

questions.question: What did the South gain from both the Compromise of the 1850 and the Kansas-Nebraska Act?

choices.answer: an enforcement of the Fugitive Slave Law
a provision to honor the Mason-Dixon line
gradual elimination of slavery in the territories added
use of popular sovereignty about slavery in the territories

questions.question: What was one immediate effect of President Abraham Lincoln's Emancipation Proclamation?

choices.answer: It ended the Civil War.
It created confusion in the South.
It abolished slavery in all states of the Union.
It led European countries to ally with the South.

questions.question: What was one significant economic reason why the South remained poor after Reconstruction?

choices.answer: the physical damage to the South from the Civil War.
the shortage of labor as freemen went to northern factories
high taxes imposed on the south as punishment for secession
$$ printed by the Confederacy,led to inflation in the South

questions.question: How did the Freedmen's Bureau assist freed slaves in the South after the Civil War?

choices.answer: It helped them start small businesses.
It gave them each forty acres of land.
It set up a sharecropping system for them.
It created educational opportunities for them.

questions.question: How did the fed. gov't use tariffs in the 1800s to help the U.S. grow into an industrial power?

choices.answer: to tax U.S. industry as a source of federal income
convince other nations to buy newly available U.S. products
support U.S. businesses that import the newest technologies
to discourage U.S. consumers from buying foreign products

questions.question: Which American political party is best represented by the diagram?

choices.answer: Populist Party
Republican Party
Progressive Party
Know-Nothing Party

questions.question: What accounted for the trend shown in this graph?

choices.answer: a decrease in productivity after World War I
an increase in state minimum working ages
an increase in skilled laborers from immigration
a decrease in children's charitable organizations

questions.question: What's a result of Democrats regaining power in the south and oppressing A-A after 1877?

choices.answer: African Americans became farm workers in the North.
Thousands of A-A families migrated to the Midwest.
The Colonization movement settled A-A in Liberia
Southern A-A refused to serve in the U.S. military

questions.question: Why did immigrants support political machines?

choices.answer: to have more educational opportunities
to reform city governments
to get better public housing
to gain employment

questions.question: Why would these women participate in such a demonstration?

choices.answer: They believed food producers sought profit > consumer safety
Wanted to promote vegetarianism as a more healthy lifestyle
They wanted to draw attention to the problems of homemakers.
They believed food-packing workers were unfairly paid.

questions.question: What event is the best example of the use of the Roosevelt Corollary to the Monroe Doctrine?

choices.answer: U.S. intervening in the Dominican Republic to collect debts
the U.S. forcing Japan to open trade with American merchants
the U.S. imposing tariffs on produce imported from Panama
the U.S. creating spheres of influence on mainland China

questions.question: How did the results of the Spanish American War affect the expansion of the United States?

choices.answer: The war ended U.S. expansion because of the large costs
The war allowed the U.S. to acquire the Texas territory
The war led to increased U.S. expansion into South America
The war gave the U.S. territories in the South Pacific

questions.question: What tactic did President Theodore Roosevelt use to get the Panama Canal built?

choices.answer: He supported a rebellion against the Colombian government
He forced the Colombian government to sign a treaty in 1903.
He leased the canal zone from an international company
He seized Panama from Spain after the Spanish American War

questions.question: Which contributed most to the Great Migration of African Americans to the North?

choices.answer: decreasing numbers of agricultural jobs in the South
improved transportation systems in the North
overcrowded conditions in southern cities
labor shortages in northern cities

questions.question: What did women's suffrage and Prohibition have in common?

choices.answer: both were motivated by anti-communist sentiments
both were successful conservative Christian crusades
both were state laws before becoming constitutional amend.
both enacted as laws by Cong, then shot down by the Sup. Ct.

questions.question: Why did many urban industrial workers support the New Deal?

choices.answer: It nationalized city utilities.
It legalized collective bargaining.
It eased regulations on businesses.
It actively supported political machines.

questions.question: Why did President FDR refrain from intervening in Europe during the rise of totalitarianism?

choices.answer: A lot of Americans didn't support U.S. involvement in Europe
FDR didn't believe the U.S. military could beat the Germans.
Leaders-Britain/France didn't want the U.S. in Euro affairs
FDR was afraid a war would further damage the U.S. economy.

questions.question: What was a major effect of World War II on the U.S. home front?

choices.answer: limited access to public transportation
shutdown of car production
price controls on goods
rationing of necessities

questions.question: How did the United States' goal in World War II differ from its goal in World War I?

choices.answer: The United States fought to end the war quickly.
The United States fought for unconditional surrender.
The United States fought to bring about a lasting peace.
The United States fought to preserve freedom and democracy.

questions.question: In the aftermath of the Holocaust, what new action did the United States take to aid Jews?

choices.answer: It created shelter programs.
It recognized Israel as a state.
It helped locate lost relatives.
It provided monetary compensation.

questions.question: How did the status of American women change in the decade following World War II?

choices.answer: They got factory jobs created by new consumer demand.
They started to earn salaries equal to men's salaries.
They returned to the home as men returned from overseas.
They earned college degrees for the first time.

questions.question: How did Martin Luther King Jr.'s strategy  differ from that of Black Power advocates?

choices.answer: King worked with white leaders.
King opposed the war in Vietnam.
King organized marches and public demonstrations.
King supported voting rights for African Americans.

questions.question: What was a common criticism of the Gulf of Tonkin Resolution?

choices.answer: Made the S. Vietnamese more vulnerable to commie aggression
It encouraged the use of guerrilla warfare in Vietnam.
It allowed the U.S. executive branch too much power.
It reduced the freedom of the American press.

questions.question: Which statement best explains the changes in economic inequality from 1980 to 2000?

choices.answer: The number of active union members increased.
The number of two-income households increased.
The number of high-wage manufacturing jobs decreased.
The number part-time and temporary workers decreased.

questions.question: What foreign policy has been a consistent feature of U.S. Pres. Truman through Pres. G.W.Bush?

choices.answer: support for the state of Israel
opposition to dictators in Iraq
friendly relations with mainland China
strained relations with France and Germany
